title.title-text: Law No. 4 of 1983 Concerning Regulation of Construction Works

group-text.paragraph: I, Khalifa Bin Zayed al Nahyan, Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi
Pursuant to the powers conferred upon me by the Ruler of Abu Dhabi,
Having reviewed;
AD Law No. (1) of 1974 reorganizing the machinery of government in the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, as amended by Law No. 5 of 1982;
AD Law No. (2) of 1971 regarding the National Consultative Council, as amended by AD Law No. (2) of 1980; and
AD Local Order No. (1) of 1976 concerning building regulations
Based on the proposal of the Chairman of the Executive Council of Abu Dhabi, approved by that Council and the National Consultative Council
Issue the following Law:
Wherever used in this Law the following terms and expressions shall have the meaning ascribed thereto hereunder:

td.paragraph: Department
Abu Dhabi Municipality & Town Planning Department or the Al Ain Municipality & Agriculture Department as the case may be
Chairman of the Department
Chairman of the Abu Dhabi Municipality & Town Planning Department or Chairman of the Al Ain Municipality & Agriculture Department as the case may be
Municipality
Abu Dhabi Municipality or Al Ain Municipality as the case may be
Town Planning
Town planning in Abu Dhabi or town planning in Al Ain as the case may be
Service Providers
Any concern with utility lines at the work site
Person
Any individual or corporate entity looking to construct a building or perform any work regulated by this Law
Contractor
Any individual or corporate entity who/ which undertakes to construct a building or perform work regulated by this Law
Engineering Firm

A licensed civil engineering and construction firm in the Emirate of Abu Dhabi that is enlisted to prepare plans and drawings for any building or project and supervise the work or to prepare plans and drawings only without supervising execution or to supervise construction work or a project designed by another engineering firm

group-text.paragraph: A person can construct a building, make additions to a building, make any modification to the exterior of a building or to its internal partitions, demolish any part of a building or alter the features of the land plot allocated for the building by digging up, filling in or leveling only after obtaining a relevant permit from the Department

1- The application for a permit shall be submitted by the employer or on his behalf to the Director of Town Planning along with all documents, drawings and plans relating to the buildings or the works described in the permit subject to fulfilling the requirements set forth in the implementing regulations of this Law
2- Drawings and plans related to the work stated on the permit as referred to in the preceding paragraph must be approved by an Engineering Firm

1- The Department shall decide the permit application within 30 days from the date on which the criteria and requirements have been satisfied and a complete submission has been made in accordance with the implementing regulations of this Law
2- In all cases the Department's decision rejecting the application or requiring the permit to be amended must be reasoned
3- If no permit is issued by the end of the period referred to in paragraph (1) of this Article then the application has been denied
1- The decision rejecting the permit or requiring it to be amended may be appealed within 30 days from the date on which the person appealing was notified of the same

2- The appeal shall be made before a committee appointed by a decision of the Chairman of the Department. The number of members on the committee shall be no less than 3, not including any persons who were on the committee that issued the decision being appealed
3- The committee's decision shall be final and shall be notified to the person who made the appeal

1- If work is not commenced, the building permit shall be valid for a period of 6 years from the date of issue. The permit may be renewed for a further period of similar duration, within 30 days from the date of expiry, provided that the renewal does not interfere with any planning going on at the time
2- The building permit shall be valid throughout the period of execution, provided that the work continues to proceed in a satisfactory manner

3- If the permit holder completely stops construction work for more than 6 consecutive months, the Department may cancel the permit if the permit holder is unable to provide a satisfactory explanation

If new planning is introduced for the area in respect of which the permit was issued, the Department may withdraw the permit or amend the same in accordance with the new plans, provided that the permit holder is paid proper compensation if he has completed construction work on the site
1- The issue or the renewal of a permit shall not affect the rights which those concerned have over the land plot described in the permit
2- In no event shall the Department have any liability in relation to the work stated on the license

The Engineering Firm and the Contractor shall to the extent that each is concerned ensure that the site is safe and free of utility lines and shall notify the Department upon commencement of the work, in accordance with the requirements set out in the implementing regulations of this Law
1- An Engineering Firm shall oversee the execution of the work. The details of the Firm must be mentioned on the permit
2- The Engineering Firm shall monitor the progress of the work to ensure that it is being carried out according to the approved plans and drawings

1- The Engineering Firm shall be liable for any damage that occurs to the building and jeopardizes its safety due to errors in the design work that was commissioned to the Firm, or due to instructions the Firm had given whilst overseeing the execution of the work
2- The Engineering Firm shall provide warranty coverage of 10 years for the building starting from the date of final handover, in the circumstances referred to in the previous paragraph

1- The Contractor shall provide a performance bond and a one year maintenance bond from the date of initial handover of the completed project. The Contractor is responsible for ensuring that the work remains in good condition during that time

2- Upon detection of the existence of a defect or damage in the work, the Contractor shall repair it at his own expense, within the time period specified by the Engineering Firm, until such time as the final completion certificate is issued

Notwithstanding the issue of the final completion certificate after the maintenance period and the settlement of all accounts relating to the building, the Contractor shall be liable for a period of 10 years from the date of initial handover for any defect or damage in the structural elements of the building including the foundation, foundation walls, concrete structures or otherwise due to cheating or negligence on the part of the Contractor and for any damage caused by such defect

The Contractor shall take all precautions necessary to ensure the general safety of those responsible for execution, and the safety of pedestrians and adjacent buildings, as required by the implementing regulations

Services and utilities can be connected to a building for which a permit has been given only after obtaining a certificate confirming that the building conforms to specifications stated in the permit issued by the Department

1- Engineers and inspectors at the Department who are charged with enforcing this law shall act as court trustees and may enter any work site to ensure that the terms and provisions of the permits are being properly complied with and report any violations

2- If a violation is established, the Director of the Municipality or other designated official shall issue a temporary order in writing requiring that the non-compliant work be suspended pending a decision on the violation from the competent court

1- The Department may issue an administrative order requiring that work be stopped on buildings and work that is in violation of the provisions of this Law and its implementing regulations while seizing the equipment and the material used for construction
2- The order issued in this regard shall be notified to the employer or other person in his place

3- The decision may be appealed to the Chairman of the Department within 30 days from the date on which the person appealing was notified of the decision being appealed. The decision given in the appeal shall be final and shall be notified to the person who appealed
The building permit shall be revoked if it was granted on the basis of wrong information or documents

If the Contractor and the Engineering Firm or either is found to be in breach of the provisions of Article Two of this Law, the Department shall revoke the professional license that was granted to the concern in question
1- The implementing regulations of this Law shall be promulgated by a decision of the Chairman of the Department
2- The implementing regulations shall fix the fees to be paid for obtaining and renewing permits and the conditions under which fees would be waived

Subject to any severer penalty, a person found to be in breach of this Law and its implementing regulations shall be liable to pay a fine of not less than AED 5,000 and not more than AED 50,000 or ordered to serve a jail term not exceeding 1 year or both. The violation shall be ordered rectified at the expense of the person responsible and the Court may order that the building be completely vacated by its occupants
Local Order No. (1) of 1976 concerning building regulations shall be cancelled together with any other provisions that conflict with his Law
This Law shall be published in the Federal Gazette and shall take effect from the beginning of the month next following the date of issue
Issued by me in Abu Dhabi
On: 8th September 1983
Table of Violations:

td.paragraph: Engagement in construction works without establishing a makeshift fence
Eliminating the causes of violation
Lack of security and safety precautions for pedestrians and neighboring buildings during construction and demolition.
Providing the required precautions
The makeshift fence around the site is not compliant with the specifications
Eliminating the causes of violation
Demolition or execution of fixed installations without building permits
Eliminating the causes of violation
Carrying out internal or external work without a building permit or such works being incompliant with the license
Eliminating the causes of violation
Performing works that do not conform to the approved scheme or technical principles
Eliminating the causes of violation
Lack of the certified schemes and the (building, demolition, improvements or maintenance) license on the site
Housing workers and technicians on work site without a license from the Municipality
Eliminating the causes of violation
Working beyond the permitted working hours without official permission
Eliminating the causes of violation
Storing material and dumping of waste on sites not designated for collecting residues and waste
Eliminating the causes of violation
Making noise beyond the allowable level
Conducting fixed construction work beyond the property
Eliminating the causes of violation
Establishing temporary facilities outside the approved property line without permit
Eliminating the causes of violation
Lack of protection around the excavation of infrastructure projects
Providing the required protection
Executing the works after 6 months from the date of issuing the building permit, without renewing the permit
Stopping the work and renewing the permit according to the required procedure
Carrying out demolition works in a way that is hazardous to passersby and neighboring facilities
Eliminating the causes of violation
Using temporary land for purposes other than the purpose assigned thereto, or violation of the usage requirements
Eliminating the causes of violation
Failure to demobilize the temporary site after expiration of the specified period or elimination of the reasons for allocation
Eliminating the of violation
Changing the dimensions of the plot of land in violation of the dimensions officially identified
Eliminating the causes of violation
Failure to remove the makeshift fence, buildings or equipment from the service lines path despite notification from the Municipality
Eliminating the causes of violation within 48 hours
Refusal to receive notice of violations or the decisions to stop work
Precluding the Municipality's engineers and controllers from entering into the site under construction
Eliminating the causes of violation
Carrying out works that do not comply with the license and which can affect the structure of the building or adjacent buildings
Eliminating the causes of violation
Failure to perform the necessary maintenance to maintain the safety and appearance of the building
Eliminating the causes of violation
Carrying out agricultural work beyond the property line without a permit
Eliminating the causes of violation
Submission of documents, plans, statements or calculations contrary to the law and building regulations
Submitting any plans, designs, accounts or studies of another entity without its consent
The Engineering Office's taking over works contrary to the approved plans and building permit during the implementation of the various phases of the building
Eliminating the causes of violation
Execution of works in the structure without the approval and signature of the inspection engineer in the Municipality for the stages that so require
Eliminating the causes of violation
Failure of the Engineering Office to carry out the monitoring and supervision
The Engineering Office's dispatching of non-professional and non-qualified persons to carry out inspection works with the Municipality
Burning the waste on the site
